name: concessional
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
offered at a better rate than usual, for example at a lower rate of tax or a higher rate of an allowance: The scheme allows the import of capital goods for export production at a concessional rate of duty. Concessional loans are available to employees that meet conditions. Food aid is provided on concessional credit terms.
More examplesFewer examplesConcessional pension contributions include deductible employer and self-employed contributions.Any earnings you receive from super investments are taxed at a concessional rate of 15%, which is generally lower than other forms of savings.There was considerable concessional lending to eastern Europe.An employee may benefit from a concessional housing loan, supplementary health benefits or childcare support.An environmental project could potentially obtain its entire project costs from concessional financing.
